div.l: I shal be holde a daffe a cokenay
I wol arise and aunter it bi my faith
Vnhardi is vnseli as men saith
And vp he ros and softli he went
Vn to þe cradel and in his hande it hent
And barre it softe vnto his beddes fete
Sone after þe wif hir routyng lete
And gan to wake and went hir out to pisse
And com agayn and gan hir cradel mysse
And groped here and þ̉ere but she fonde noon
Allas ꝙquod she I had almost mys goon
I had almost gon to þe clerkes bedde
Ey benedicite þan had I foule I spedde
And forþ she goþ til she the cradel fonde
She gropeþ always ferþ̉er with hir honde
And fonde þe bedde and þought not but good
Because þat þe cradel bi it stode
And nyst where she was for it was derk
But faire and wel she crept in to þe clerk
And lith ful stille and wolde haue caught a slepe
Withinne a while þis Iohn þe clerc vp lepe
And on þis good wif he leith on soore
So mery a fitte ne had she not ful yore
He prikeþ harde and depe as he were madde
This Ioli lif han þis too clerkꝭes ladde
Til þat þe þirde cok began to singe
Aleyn wax wery in þe dawenyng
For he had swonken al þe long night
And seide fare wel Malyn swete wight
The dai is come I mai no lenger bide
But eủere moo where so I go or ride
I am þin owne clerc so haue I hele
Now dere lemman ꝙquod she go farewele
